subject: Public Speaking
title: Kairos: The Right Moment to Speak
description: Learn Kairos: The Right Moment to Speak in one minute.

hook.text: The ancient Greeks had a word for the perfect moment to make your argument. They called it kairos.

buildup.text: Kairos means timing â€” saying the right thing at the right time, when the audience is most receptive.

discovery.text: A brilliant argument delivered at the wrong moment falls flat. Context and timing are part of the persuasion.

twist.text: Churchill understood kairos. He saved his best speeches for Britain's darkest hours, when people needed them most.

climax.text: Persuasion is not just what you say or how you say it. It's when you say it. Timing is a rhetorical tool.

punchline.text: The right words at the wrong time are the wrong words.

quiz.question: What does 'kairos' mean in rhetoric?
options: The right moment to make an argument
